fields.public_field_1_en: The first item on your agenda: a call with a local tenants' rights advocate about the growing problem with housing affordability in your city.
fields.public_field_2_en: Answer the call

fields.public_field_1_en: Tenants' Rights Advocate
fields.public_field_2_en: The average family today spends around twenty five percent of its income on housing, and there are many families that spend much more. We know that building affordable housing can be expensive and the city’s budget is already stretched, but something needs to be done. If we do not advance any new policies, the average family could spend as much as half of its income on housing within the next few decades.
fields.public_field_3_en: Go to your Housing Plan!

fields.public_field_2_en: Raise new revenue to fund affordable housing production and preservation
fields.public_field_3_en: Generate new funds to build affordable housing and preserve existing affordable units through new fees or taxes.
fields.public_field_4_en: This would provide a continuous stream of funds to address the need for affordable housing over time.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Strategy 1 pros
fields.public_field_5_en: New taxes and fees could increase the cost of living for existing Bay Area residents, and local business leaders are opposed.
fields.public_field_8_en: Require 20 percent of all new housing to be affordable
fields.public_field_9_en: Require developers to set aside twenty percent of all newly constructed units to be rented at a subsidized rate.
fields.public_field_10_en: The costs of building affordable units would be paid by developers, instead of by the city or nonprofit groups.
fields.public_field_11_en: The required subsidy may discourage new development, making the housing shortage worse than before.
fields.public_field_15_en: Adopt a set of renter protections to prevent large rent increases and unjustified evictions.
fields.public_field_16_en: This strategy would shield renters from large or unexpected rent increases and unlawful or unjustified evictions, providing renters with more stable housing conditions.
fields.public_field_17_en: Limiting the profitability of providing rental housing could reduce the overall supply of units for rent.

fields.public_field_1_en: raise new revenue to fund affordable housing production and preservation!
fields.public_field_3_en: Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to produce between 400 and 600 new permanently affordable rental units each year. That’s around 11,000 to 17,000 units between now and 2050. Thousands more already affordable units were maintained and remained affordable.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to the two remaining housing challenges.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: require 20 percent of all new housing to be affordable!
fields.public_field_3_en: Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to produce between 2,400 and 4,000 new permanently affordable rental units each year. That’s around 70,000 to 100,000 units between now and 2050. However, this policy only improved affordability for those that were able to move to these new units and did not help people afford to stay in their existing homes.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to the two remaining housing challenges.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: increase renter protections!
fields.public_field_3_en: A similar set of policies implemented in Portland, Oregon capped annual rent increases at 2% and resulted in a fifteen percent decrease in no-fault evictions.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to the two remaining housing challenges.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spend> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: Which strategy will you choose to make housing more affordable?
fields.public_field_2_en: Make a decision

fields.public_field_1_en: Your housing plan is almost complete! The final item is choosing a strategy to guide infill development on vacant or underutilized properties throughout the city. Your next stop is the Citizens’ Advisory Council meeting, where you will hear about two proposals for infill development in your city.
fields.public_field_2_en: Let’s see what they’re saying!

fields.public_field_1_en: Resident
fields.public_field_2_en: Our city owns some land that is currently sitting vacant, with no plans for future use. Since we already own that land, building housing there would be cheaper and faster than if we had to find a site and buy it first. We could build there ourselves or sell the land to an affordable housing developer.
fields.public_field_3_en: See what they have to say

fields.public_field_1_en: Resident
fields.public_field_2_en: There are several malls around town that have seen better days. Storefronts have been empty for months, and it is only going to get worse as more people choose to shop online. We could work with the mall owners to turn these sites into vibrant neighborhoods with a mix of housing, workplaces, and shops!
fields.public_field_3_en: Go to your Housing Plan!

fields.public_field_1_en: Which sites would you prioritize for reuse and redevelopment?
fields.public_field_2_en: Repurpose public land to build housing
fields.public_field_3_en: Adopt a local law to make it possible to build housing on vacant or underutilized publicly owned land.
fields.public_field_4_en: The city can either build publicly-owned affordable housing itself or sell the land to a developer under the condition that a certain number of affordable housing units are built.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Strategy 1 pros
fields.public_field_5_en: The city could generate more tax revenue if they used the public land for a new shopping center or office park, providing you with more funding to fulfill your campaign promises.
fields.public_field_9_en: Work with property owners to redevelop vacant and under-performing shopping centers into mixed-income neighborhoods.
fields.public_field_10_en: These sites are often located on large lots near existing public transportation routes, making them ideal candidates for redevelopment.
fields.public_field_11_en: Convincing property owners and all of their tenants to vacate so that the malls could be redeveloped could require additional time. If even one tenant refuses to leave, redeveloping the site would not be possible.

fields.public_field_1_en: repurpose public land to build housing!
fields.public_field_3_en: Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to produce between 1,000 and 2,000 new homes each year. While this covers just a small fraction of the projected need for new housing in the region, these new homes tend to be more affordable than the average home in the region.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to the last housing challenge.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: transform aging malls into neighborhoods!
fields.public_field_3_en: Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to produce between 3,000 and 6,000 new homes per year. Additionally, new stores and other workplaces in the new neighborhoods are expected to employ almost twice as many people as were employed when the malls were in operation.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to the remaining housing challenge.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: Your Housing Plan
fields.public_field_2_en: Check out your Housing Plan below
fields.public_field_3_en: Housing affordability
fields.public_field_4_en: Regional Policy
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Challenge 2

fields.public_field_1_en: You’ve completed the first section of your housing plan. Time for a social media break! You see some residents are debating land use policies for the housing plan.
fields.public_field_2_en: Let’s see what they’re saying.

fields.public_field_1_en: MoreHousingMoreRiders
fields.public_field_2_en: Transit and higher density housing make sense together.
fields.public_field_3_en: We should change those zoning regulations to make it possible to build duplexes and apartments within walking distance of transit.
fields.public_field_4_en: Existing homes wouldn’t necessarily be rebuilt, but at least property owners would have the option.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: User 1 message 3
fields.public_field_6_en: Some neighborhoods have better schools, more parks, and better transportation options.
fields.public_field_7_en: Unfortunately, these same neighborhoods tend to have high costs of living, and only those that can afford to live there benefit from these opportunities.
fields.public_field_8_en: If we allowed for more affordable housing in these neighborhoods, people of all walks of life could have the chance to benefit from these resources.

fields.public_field_1_en: Which policy would you choose to guide future development in your town?
fields.public_field_2_en: Make a decision

fields.public_field_1_en: John
fields.public_field_2_en: Existing homes wouldn’t necessarily be rebuilt, but it gives property owners the option.
fields.public_field_3_en: NEEDS_TO_BE_FILLED_IN

fields.public_field_1_en: John
fields.public_field_2_en: Some neighborhoods in Bayville have better schools, more parks, and better transportation options.
fields.public_field_3_en: NEEDS_TO_BE_FILLED_IN

fields.public_field_1_en: John
fields.public_field_2_en: Unfortunately, these same neighborhoods tend to have high housing costs, meaning only those that can afford to live there have access to these opportunities.
fields.public_field_3_en: NEEDS_TO_BE_FILLED_IN

fields.public_field_1_en: John
fields.public_field_2_en: If we allowed for more affordable housing in these neighborhoods, people of all walks of life could have the chance to benefit from these resources.
fields.public_field_3_en: These ideas could work for Bayville!

fields.public_field_1_en: Which policy would you choose to guide future development in your town?
fields.public_field_2_en: Allow affordable housing in high-opportunity areas
fields.public_field_3_en: Allow for the construction of mixed-income housing in high-opportunity areas - places with quality schools or other resources linked to better life outcomes.
fields.public_field_4_en: Low- and moderate-income families that move to high-opportunity areas would benefit from resources that were previously out of reach. This strategy is a change to zoning regulations, meaning it requires no government subsidy.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Strategy 1 pros
fields.public_field_5_en: Building more housing could result in changes to the architectural character of these neighborhoods, which may result in homeowner opposition.
fields.public_field_8_en: Allow diverse housing around transit stops
fields.public_field_9_en: Adopt more flexible zoning standards along major transit corridors to allow for apartments, duplexes, and mixed-use developments.
fields.public_field_10_en: This policy provides more people with access to transit while also providing new riders for transit systems and more patrons for local businesses near transit corridors.
fields.public_field_11_en: Improving access to employment centers could increase land values, making existing and new rental housing near transit more expensive if subsidies are not put in place.

fields.public_field_1_en: allow affordable housing in high-opportunity areas!
fields.public_field_3_en: Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to produce affordable housing for between 100 and 400 households each year within high resource neighborhoods. While this represents a relatively small share of all new affordable units, residents of these neighborhoods may expect to benefit from a lack of concentrated poverty and easier access to amenities like parks and quality schools. Unfortunately, this policy is unpopular with some residents of those high resource neighborhoods, which could hurt your chances of re-election next term.
fields.public_field_4_en: Go to your Housing Plan to review your plans for Bayville!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: allow diverse housing around transit stops!
fields.public_field_3_en: Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to produce housing for between 20,000 and 40,000 households located within a ten minute walk of frequent transit service. Building housing close to transit is likely to have a number of secondary benefits, including decreases in individual transportation costs and greenhouse gas emissions from transportation. However, a group of people that already lived close to transit stops have written to you to express concerns that they will be displaced by luxury development and rising housing costs on their blocks.
fields.public_field_4_en: Go to your Housing Plan to review your plans for Bayville!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: You get to your office and sit down at your desk. You hear a knock at the door - it’s the planning commissioner here for your monthly meeting. Today’s topic: policies to influence the location of jobs.
fields.public_field_2_en: Open the door.

fields.public_field_1_en: City Manager
fields.public_field_2_en: Over time, parts of our city have become primarily residential, while jobs have concentrated in neighborhoods around downtown. Every morning, waves of workers travel from the residential neighborhoods to their workplaces downtown, resulting in traffic congestion and crowded buses and trains. If more neighborhoods had a mix of jobs and housing, peak commute periods would be less hectic.
fields.public_field_3_en: Go to your economy plan!

fields.public_field_1_en: Which approach would you take to address the mismatch of jobs and housing?
fields.public_field_2_en: Make a decision
Place office caps in jobs-rich locations
fields.public_field_3_en: Limit the number of new office buildings that can be built each year in areas with many more jobs than residents.
fields.public_field_4_en: This could make office space in high-demand areas more expensive, encouraging other employers to seek cheaper land or rents elsewhere within the region.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Strategy 1 pros
fields.public_field_5_en: Placing a limit on where office space can be built could lead to some employers moving out of the city.
fields.public_field_8_en: Create incubator program in economically challenged neighborhoods
fields.public_field_9_en: Provide resources to support the creation of businesses by low- and moderate-income people in communities with limited job opportunities.
fields.public_field_10_en: This strategy could spur economic activity, create jobs, and keep wealth circulating within the economically challenged communities.
fields.public_field_11_en: Small businesses need time to grow and mature before they can provide a substantial number of jobs.

fields.public_field_1_en: place office caps in jobs-rich locations!
fields.public_field_3_en: New office developments are starting to pop up in residential areas. However, some businesses have threatened to move jobs to a neighboring city where offices are cheaper, leading residents to worry this policy could damage the local economy. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to increase the number of jobs in predominantly residential areas by XX percent and increase the amount of new home construction in employment centers by XX percent by 2050, leading to a more balanced distribution of homes and jobs.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other economic issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: create incubator program in economically challenged neighborhoods!
fields.public_field_3_en: New incubators are opening in communities around the city. While most new businesses have just a few employees for now, several businesses have grown rapidly. These growing businesses are hiring new employees and doing business in their communities, which has benefitted other local shops. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to increase the number of overall jobs in economically challenged communities from XXX to XXX by 2050, more than doubling total employment in these areas which have previously seen few job opportunities for residents.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other economic issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: Your Economy Plan
fields.public_field_2_en: Check out your Economy Plan
fields.public_field_3_en: Workforce
fields.public_field_4_en: Shift Location of Jobs
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Challenge 2

fields.public_field_1_en: You have a full schedule today, which means you are on your way to work early. As you wait for your train, your phone starts buzzing. It looks like one of your posts seeking input for the economy plan has gone viral!
fields.public_field_2_en: Keep reading

fields.public_field_1_en: BackToWork
fields.public_field_2_en: Many working parents can’t afford childcare and have to put their careers on hold because of it.
fields.public_field_3_en: If we provided low-cost childcare to low-income families, parents would have the option to return to work or school if they wanted, without having to weigh the costs of childcare
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: DO NOT USE
fields.public_field_6_en: With a growing population like ours, we need to build more housing and maintain our infrastructure.
fields.public_field_7_en: We don’t have enough trained people to fill the construction jobs we have today, much less meet the increased demand in the future.
fields.public_field_8_en: Investing in training the construction workforce will help us keep up and will provide more middle-wage jobs.
fields.public_field_10_en: Many people in our city today are part-time or freelance workers.
fields.public_field_11_en: They like the flexibility, but most of these jobs don’t provide benefits like health insurance the way many full-time jobs do.
fields.public_field_12_en: We should require employers to pay for a fair share of worker benefits.

fields.public_field_1_en: Which workforce policy do you want to implement?
fields.public_field_2_en: Make a decision
Provide portable benefits for part-time and freelance workers
fields.public_field_3_en: Pass state legislation requiring companies that rely on part-time or freelance workers to contribute benefits in proportion to the hours worked.
fields.public_field_4_en: This would reduce the costs of obtaining insurance for thousands of part-time or freelance workers
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Strategy 1 pros
fields.public_field_5_en: Businesses that rely on part-time or freelance workers could choose to employ fewer people, automate jobs, or move away entirely, reducing the total number of jobs in the city.
fields.public_field_8_en: Expand childcare support for low-income families
fields.public_field_9_en: Provide reduced cost childcare for low-income families, enabling parents to return to work or attend school without worrying about the cost of childcare.
fields.public_field_10_en: This strategy would allow thousands of parents to return to work or school and would benefit children through education and socialization.
fields.public_field_11_en: Providing safe, high quality childcare can be expensive. Costs to operate this program could increase substantially in the future if many families choose to participate.
fields.public_field_15_en: Partner with neighboring cities and the construction industry to provide training programs, apprenticeships, and financial incentives that prepare workers for middle-wage construction-related jobs.
fields.public_field_16_en: This would address the current deficit in the construction workforce, training the workers needed to build new housing and maintain infrastructure.
fields.public_field_17_en: This program could be seen as subsidizing the training costs of privately-owned construction companies

fields.public_field_1_en: provide portable benefits for part-time and freelance workers!
fields.public_field_3_en: Companies that hire part-time or freelance workers now contribute to their workers’ insurance costs based on the number of hours worked. Without this strategy, these workers would have had to pay the full cost of benefits out of pocket or risk being uninsured. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to benefit XXX part-time or freelance workers each year.
fields.public_field_4_en: You have <coins_left> coins remaining. Check out your Economic Plan!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: expand childcare support for low-income families!
fields.public_field_3_en: Families are already enrolling their children, and new workers are returning to the labor force. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to enable XXX additional people this year to join the workforce and XXX additional people to enroll in higher education. Women would especially benefit from this strategy - with XX percent of the new workers and students being women.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other economic issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: expand construction workforce programs!
fields.public_field_3_en: There is a line out the door to sign up for training programs at the local community college! New trainees are excited to learn a new trade and enter the construction workforce. Many of these new positions will be middle-wage jobs that do not require a college degree, providing new pathways to economic opportunity. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to increase the number of construction jobs from XXX to XXX by 2050, more than doubling total employment in the industry.
fields.public_field_4_en: Click here to view your Economy Plan!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: You get back to your office after the community meeting. Suddenly, everything starts to shake. This time, it was just a small tremor - no major damage to report. However, it has started a conversation online about how the city should respond to the threat of a major earthquake.
fields.public_field_1_es: Regresará a su oficina después de la reunión comunitaria. De repente, todo comienza a temblar. Esta vez, fue solo un pequeño temblor, no se reportaron daños importantes. Sin embargo, ha comenzado una conversación en línea sobre cómo la ciudad debería responder a la amenaza de un gran terremoto.
fields.public_field_1_cn: 社區會議結束後，您將回到辦公室。 突然間，一切都開始動搖了。 這一次，它只是一個小震顫 - 報告沒有重大損害。 然而，它已經開始在網上談論城市應該如何應對大地震的威脅。
fields.public_field_2_en: Check messages

fields.public_field_1_en: LomaPrieta1989
fields.public_field_2_en: Geologists say the next major earthquake is likely to happen by the year 2050.
fields.public_field_2_es: Los geólogos dicen que es probable que el próximo gran terremoto ocurra para el año 2050.
fields.public_field_2_cn: 地質學家說，下一次大地震很可能發生在2050年。
fields.public_field_3_en: The city needs to buy a disaster recovery bond that would provide us with funds to start rebuilding right away, without having to wait for federal assistance.
fields.public_field_3_es: La ciudad necesita comprar un bono de recuperación por desastre que nos proporcionaría fondos para comenzar a reconstruir de inmediato, sin tener que esperar la asistencia federal.
fields.public_field_3_cn: 該市需要購買災難恢復債券，這將為我們提供資金，立即開始重建，而無需等待聯邦援助。
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: DO NOT USE
fields.public_field_6_en: An earthquake could destroy thousands of homes and other buildings.
fields.public_field_6_es: Un terremoto podría destruir miles de casas y otros edificios.
fields.public_field_6_cn: 地震可能會摧毀數以千計的房屋和其他建築物。
fields.public_field_7_en: What our city needs is a low-interest loan program that homeowners could use to retrofit their homes and reduce their risk of damage before the next earthquake strikes.
fields.public_field_7_es: What our city needs is a low-interest loan program that homeowners could use to retrofit their homes and reduce their risk of damage before the next earthquake strikes.
fields.public_field_7_cn: 我們的城市需要的是一項低息貸款計劃，房主可以在下次地震發生前用它來改造房屋，降低房屋受損風險。
fields.public_field_8_en: Landlords could use the fund to improve their properties, too!
fields.public_field_8_es: ¡Los propietarios también podrían usar el fondo para mejorar sus propiedades!
fields.public_field_8_cn: 房東也可以使用該基金來改善他們的房產！

fields.public_field_1_en: Which strategy would you add to your environment plan to prepare for a future earthquake?
fields.public_field_1_es: ¿Qué estrategia agregaría a su plan ambiental para prepararse para un terremoto futuro?
fields.public_field_1_cn: 您將為您的環境計劃添加哪種策略來為未來的地震做好準備？
fields.public_field_2_en: Make a decision
Purchase disaster recovery financing to rebuild after disasters
fields.public_field_2_es: Comprar financiamiento de recuperación de desastres para reconstruir después de desastres
fields.public_field_2_cn: 購買災後恢復融資，以便在災後重建
fields.public_field_3_en: Purchase a catastrophe bond that would provide funds for recovery in the event of a disaster like an earthquake or wildfire.
fields.public_field_3_es: Compre un bono de catástrofe que proporcionaría fondos para la recuperación en caso de un desastre como un terremoto o un incendio forestal.
fields.public_field_3_cn: 購買災難債券，在發生地震或野火等災難時為恢復提供資金。
fields.public_field_4_en: Disaster financing funds could be ready quickly and would shorten the amount of time it takes to rebuild.
fields.public_field_4_es: Los fondos de financiamiento para desastres podrían estar listos rápidamente y acortarían la cantidad de tiempo que lleva reconstruir.
fields.public_field_4_cn: 災害融資資金可以快速準備就緒，並縮短重建所需的時間。
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Strategy 1 pros
fields.public_field_5_en: This strategy does not do anything to protect damage from occurring
fields.public_field_5_es: Esta estrategia no hace nada para evitar que ocurra el daño.
fields.public_field_5_cn: 該策略無法保護損害不發生
fields.public_field_8_en: Expand financing for energy, water, seismic, fire, and accessibility improvements
fields.public_field_8_es: Ampliar el financiamiento para mejoras de energía, agua, sísmica, incendio y accesibilidad.
fields.public_field_8_cn: 擴大能源，水，地震，火災和可達性改善的融資
fields.public_field_9_en: Provide low-cost loans to owners of existing homes and commercial buildings to upgrade their properties to better withstand natural disasters.
fields.public_field_9_es: Proporcione préstamos de bajo costo a los propietarios de viviendas y edificios comerciales existentes para mejorar sus propiedades y resistir mejor los desastres naturales.
fields.public_field_9_cn: 向現有住宅和商業建築的業主提供低成本貸款，以升級他們的房產，以更好地抵禦自然災害。
fields.public_field_10_en: This strategy reduces the number of homes lost to earthquake damage
fields.public_field_10_es: Esta estrategia reduce la cantidad de viviendas perdidas por daños por terremotos
fields.public_field_10_cn: 這種策略減少了因地震而受損的房屋數量
fields.public_field_11_en: This strategy largely benefits homeowners that have the resources to make these upgrades, leaving out renters and lower-income homeowners.
fields.public_field_11_es: Esta estrategia beneficia en gran medida a los propietarios de viviendas que tienen los recursos para realizar estas mejoras, dejando de lado a inquilinos y propietarios de bajos ingresos.
fields.public_field_11_cn: 這種策略在很大程度上有利於擁有資源進行這些升級的房主，而不是租房者和低收入房主。

fields.public_field_1_en: purchase disaster recovery financing to recover after disasters!
fields.public_field_1_es: ¡compre financiamiento de recuperación ante desastres para recuperarse después de desastres!
fields.public_field_1_cn: 購買災難恢復融資災後恢復！
fields.public_field_3_en: With the disaster fund, you can breathe easy knowing that you will have the resources to rebuild in the event of an earthquake. However, the bond does not reduce the amount of damage that occurs, meaning life in your city could still be significantly disrupted. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to increase the rate of housing production after a simulated major earthquake from XXX homes per year to XXX homes per year.
fields.public_field_3_es: Con el fondo para desastres, puede respirar tranquilo sabiendo que tendrá los recursos para reconstruir en caso de terremoto. Sin embargo, el vínculo no reduce la cantidad de daño que se produce, lo que significa que la vida en tu ciudad aún podría verse significativamente afectada. Se estima que la implementación de esta estrategia en el Área de la Bahía aumentará la tasa de producción de viviendas después de un gran terremoto simulado de XXX hogares por año a XXX hogares por año.
fields.public_field_3_cn: 通過災難基金，您可以輕鬆地知道您將有資源在發生地震時重建。 但是，債券不會減少發生的損害，這意味著您所在城市的生活仍然可能會受到嚴重干擾。 據估計，在海灣地區實施這一戰略後，每年從XXX個家庭到每年XXX個家庭的模擬大地震後，住房生產率將提高。
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other environmental issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_es: Ahora solo tiene monedas <coins_left> para implementar estrategias relacionadas con otros 2 problemas ambientales. ¡No gastes demasiado!
fields.public_field_4_cn: 現在您只有<coins_left>硬幣來實施與其他2個環境問題相關的策略。 不要花太多錢！
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: expand financing for energy, water, seismic, fire, and accessibility improvements!
fields.public_field_1_es: expanda el financiamiento para mejoras en energía, agua, sísmica, incendio y accesibilidad!
fields.public_field_1_cn: 擴大能源，水，地震，火災和可達性改善的融資！
fields.public_field_3_en: Homeowners and landlords have already started to renovate their buildings. The projected number of homes lost to earthquake damage decreases with every building that is retrofitted. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to decrease the number of homes destroyed in the event of a major earthquake from XXX to XXX and would likely reduce the number of deaths and injuries as well.
fields.public_field_3_es: Los propietarios y propietarios ya han comenzado a renovar sus edificios. El número proyectado de viviendas perdidas por el daño del terremoto disminuye con cada edificio que se actualiza. Se estima que la implementación de esta estrategia en el Área de la Bahía disminuirá la cantidad de viviendas destruidas en caso de un terremoto importante de XXX a XXX y probablemente también reducirá la cantidad de muertes y lesiones.
fields.public_field_3_cn: 房主和房東已經開始翻新他們的建築物。 每個被改造的建築物預計遭受地震破壞的房屋數量會減少。 據估計，在灣區實施這一戰略將減少在XXX至XXX發生大地震時被摧毀的房屋數量，並可能減少死亡和受傷人數。
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other housing issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_es: Ahora solo tiene monedas <coins_left> para implementar estrategias relacionadas con otros 2 problemas de vivienda. ¡No gastes demasiado!
fields.public_field_4_cn: 現在你只有<coins_left>硬幣來實施與其他2個住房問題相關的策略。 不要花太多錢！
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: Your Environment Plan
fields.public_field_2_en: Check out your Environment Plan below!
fields.public_field_3_en: Open Space
fields.public_field_4_en: Sea Level Rise
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Challenge 2

fields.public_field_1_en: You are taking a walk through the park when you see the local environmental advocacy organization setting up for a rally. You walk over and strike up a conversation with one of the volunteers.
fields.public_field_2_en: Stop to listen.

Our city’s population is projected to continue growing between now and 2050. That means more people will be using our parks and natural spaces every day. We want to accommodate these new visitors while also maintaining our parks, trails, and greenways in good condition. We need to pass a measure to generate new revenue for maintenance and new facilities. Do you think you could include this in your plan?
fields.public_field_3_en: Go to your environment plan!

fields.public_field_1_en: Do you support this proposal, or would you rather save your budget to address other environmental challenges?
fields.public_field_2_en: Make a decision
Pass a regional measure for parks, trails, and greenways
fields.public_field_3_en: Pass a regional funding measure to generate new money for open space preservation, recreational trails, and wildlife corridors.
fields.public_field_4_en: This strategy would provide funding to expand maintenance as the population grows, protecting parks and recreation areas from overuse and opening new facilities where possible.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Strategy 1 pros
fields.public_field_5_en: The regional measure would have to be paid back using funds from new taxes and fees or from the general fund.

fields.public_field_1_en: pass a regional measure for parks, trails, and greenways
fields.public_field_3_en: You selected pass a regional measure for parks, trails, and greenways! TBD, depends on how policy will be evaluated
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 1 other environmental issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: FILL IN
fields.public_field_3_en: FILL IN
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other environmental issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: Now that you have made your decision on the funding measure, it is time to head to your next meeting of the day. You have a community meeting at your city’s beachside neighborhood, where residents will be discussing sea level rise.
fields.public_field_2_en: Let’s go!

fields.public_field_1_en: Resident 1
fields.public_field_2_en: Sea levels are projected to rise between 1 and 3 feet over the next 30 years. This could flood roads and homes in our city’s coastal communities. Personally, I think we need to adapt all of our coastal communities to sea level rise to prevent flooding. We have a number of tools to use: marsh restoration, levees, and sea walls, to name a few!
fields.public_field_3_en: See what __ has to say

fields.public_field_1_en: Resident 2
fields.public_field_2_en: I agree that sea level rise is a major threat, and I wish we could fully adapt to sea level rise as well. Unfortunately, some places are not easy to protect, and it would cost a lot to make a small difference. I say we partially adapt to sea level rise, agreeing to let some places flood when the cost does not justify the benefit.
fields.public_field_3_en: See what __ has to say

fields.public_field_1_en: Resident 3
fields.public_field_2_en: Sea level rise is already affecting our community. There’s a highway north of town that already floods during heavy rains. It’s not located in the most populous part of town, but I still think we should direct our money toward fixing that problem first.
fields.public_field_3_en: Those are both interesting ideas!

fields.public_field_1_en: How will you plan to adapt to sea level rise?
fields.public_field_2_en: Make a Decision
Partially adapt to sea level rise
fields.public_field_3_en: Use marsh restoration, levees, and sea walls to protect the parts of the community most vulnerable to sea level rise, accepting that difficult to protect areas will eventually be flooded.
fields.public_field_4_en: This strategy targets resources at the easiest to protect areas.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Strategy 1 pros
fields.public_field_5_en: This strategy only protects some communities, leaving around 25 percent of vulnerable land area to be flooded.
fields.public_field_8_en: Fully adapt to sea level rise
fields.public_field_9_en: Use marsh restoration, levees, and sea walls to protect all at-risk communities from up to three feet of sea level rise.
fields.public_field_10_en: All communities are protected from up to three feet of sea level rise.
fields.public_field_11_en: Protecting the remaining 25 percent of communities is much more expensive than the first 75 percent.
fields.public_field_14_en: Adapt a highway to sea level rise
fields.public_field_15_en: Adapt one highway which is frequently flooded by rains and forecasted to be permanently closed due to flooding by the year 2050, like Highway 37 in the North Bay.
fields.public_field_16_en: Adapting the road to sea level rise would address the flooding problem that currently exists, while the other strategies protect areas that are not yet affected by flooding.
fields.public_field_17_en: This is one of the lesser-used highways in a lower-density part of the community, meaning relatively few people use it.

fields.public_field_1_en: partially adapt to sea level rise!
fields.public_field_3_en: Your team immediately springs to action, planting marshes and installing levees and sea walls in strategic locations. Unfortunately, residents living in an area that will remain unprotected are unhappy with the policy and are calling for your removal. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to decrease the number of flooded homes from  XXX to XXX by 2050, with over XXX acres protected from flooding if the sea level were to rise up to three feet.
fields.public_field_4_en: You have <coins_left> coins remaining. Check out your Environment Plan!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: fully adapt to sea level rise!
fields.public_field_3_en: Your team knows that protecting all threatened areas from sea level rise will be a challenge, but they come up with a plan and get to work implementing it. Unfortunately, some residents are upset with the cost of the project and are calling on you to cut back the project scope. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to decrease the number of flooded homes from  XXX to 0 by 2050, with over XXX acres protected from flooding if the sea level were to rise up to three feet.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other environmental issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: adapt a key highway to sea level rise!
fields.public_field_3_en: Residents are pleased to see construction crews at work on the at-risk highway. However, usage has been lower than anticipated, meaning the cost per user is high compared to other projects. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area on State Route 37, which connects Solano and Marin counties, would prevent this corridor from flooding in the event of sea level rise up to three feet. Without this strategy, average travel times for North Bay residents are expected to increase from XX minutes to XX minutes by 2050, as travelers are forced to find more indirect routes around the flooded roadway. While the strategy has a specific geographic focus, its effects could reduce traffic on nearby roads as well.
fields.public_field_4_en: You have <coins_left> coins remaining. Go to your Environmental Plan.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: After another eventful day as mayor, it is time to head home. It’s evening rush hour, and your train is packed as usual. You squeeze into an open spot, and the doors close. You start up a conversation with the person standing next to you.
fields.public_field_2_en: What do they have to say?

fields.public_field_1_en: Resident 1
fields.public_field_2_en: During rush hour, trains and buses are standing room only and traffic congestion is bumper to bumper. If we don’t invest in our transit system now and our city continues to grow, residents and workers will have an even harder time getting where they need to be. You’re the mayor - what are you going to do for public transportation?
fields.public_field_3_en: Go to your transportation plan!

fields.public_field_1_en: What’s your top priority for investing in public transit?
fields.public_field_2_en: Make a Decision
Modernize the existing rail network
fields.public_field_3_en: Improve the infrastructure and technology currently in place on the rail system through projects like elevating light rail above traffic and upgrading train control systems to accommodate more frequent service.
fields.public_field_4_en: This strategy would make transit a more attractive service by increasing speed and frequency.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Strategy 1 pros
fields.public_field_5_en: This strategy only directly benefits those that already live near rail transit.
fields.public_field_9_en: Connect more neighborhoods and communities directly to the rail system by extending existing lines or building new lines.
fields.public_field_10_en: This strategy would increase the number of destinations accessible by transit.
fields.public_field_11_en: Expanding the transit service area would increase operations and maintenance costs.
fields.public_field_14_en: Build and operate a next-generation bus rapid transit network
fields.public_field_15_en: Invest in the development of a more extensive bus rapid transit network, including the creation of bus-only lanes that let buses travel faster on congested roads and enhanced stations that let passengers board more quickly.
fields.public_field_16_en: This strategy can be implemented relatively quickly and at a lower cost than rail transit.
fields.public_field_17_en: Bus rapid transit cannot accommodate as many people as rail transit can, meaning this service could become overcrowded more quickly.

fields.public_field_1_en: modernize the existing rail network!
fields.public_field_3_en: Transit operators in your city are preparing to upgrade their technology and vehicles. Ridership is projected to increase shortly after these projects are complete. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to reduce the share of residents that drive to work from XX percent to XX percent by 2050.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other transportation issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: extend the regional rail network!
fields.public_field_3_en: While the new stations will not be open for a while, residents that live near a new station are already looking forward to opening day. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to reduce the share of residents that drive to work from XX percent to XX percent by 2050. Around XXX more residents would live within a ten minute walk of rail transit thanks to this strategy.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other transportation issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: build and operate a next-generation bus rapid transit network
fields.public_field_3_en: The new and improved bus lines will provide a higher quality service, reducing travel times for existing bus riders and attracting new riders looking to improve their commutes. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to reduce the share of residents that drive to work from XX percent to XX percent by 2050. Around XXX more residents will live within a ten minute walk of improved bus transit.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other transportation issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: Your Transportation Plan
fields.public_field_2_en: Check out your Transportation Plan below
fields.public_field_3_en: Price Transportation Service
fields.public_field_4_en: Prioritize Active Modes
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Challenge 2

fields.public_field_1_en: The first item on today’s agenda is a forum hosted by the economics club at the local community college. They will be discussing their ideas for the future of transportation pricing and payment - just in time for you to consider their ideas for your transportation plan!
fields.public_field_2_en: Let’s hear what they have to say.

fields.public_field_1_en: Resident 1
fields.public_field_2_en: There are so many transportation options these days. We have bike share, scooter share, ridehailing services, and public transit - plus, who knows what new type of transportation will show up next week!? Getting around would be so much easier if we had a free smartphone app that showed all of the transportation options and let you pay for them with one click.
fields.public_field_3_en: See what the next person has to say.

fields.public_field_1_en: Resident 2
fields.public_field_2_en: Did you know that after housing and food, transportation is the third largest cost in most people’s budgets? I think we should make public transit free for low-income people. That way, everyone could get to where they need to be without having to weigh the cost of taking transit.
fields.public_field_3_en: See what the next person has to say.

fields.public_field_1_en: Resident 3
fields.public_field_2_en: Traffic congestion is a serious problem in our city. If we charged a small fee for every mile driven on the highway, maybe some people would consider carpooling, taking transit, walking, or biking instead. We could even vary the fee to give a discount to carpoolers or people traveling outside of rush hour. We could invest the fee revenue in improving and expanding transit service.
fields.public_field_3_en: Go to your transportation plan!

fields.public_field_1_en: Which pricing and payment strategy do you want to implement?
fields.public_field_2_en: Make a Decision
Develop a single platform to access and pay for all mobility options
fields.public_field_3_en: Invest in the development of a free smartphone app that shows users all of their transportation options, including public transit, ridehailing, and shared mobility, for any given trip and lets them pay for their trip from one account, which can be linked to a debit card or loaded with cash at a kiosk.
fields.public_field_4_en: This strategy would improve the transportation experience for users of all types of transportation.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Strategy 1 pros
fields.public_field_5_en: This strategy could incentivize more automobile trips taken via a ridehailing service.
fields.public_field_8_en: Provide free transit to low-income riders
fields.public_field_9_en: Work with transit operators to create a free transit program for qualifying low-income residents.
fields.public_field_10_en: This strategy would reduce the financial barrier to public transit, increasing the mobility options for low-income riders.
fields.public_field_11_en: Free transit could lead to large increases in ridership, resulting in overcrowding and higher maintenance costs.
fields.public_field_14_en: Apply time-of-day tolls on all freeways
fields.public_field_15_en: Apply a toll on Bay Area freeways that varies based on the number of miles driven, with discounts for carpoolers and travel outside of periods of peak demand.
fields.public_field_16_en: This strategy would incentivize more sustainable transportation choices while also generating revenue for transit and active transportation.
fields.public_field_17_en: Charging the same per-mile toll, regardless of income, would have a larger impact on low-income people.

fields.public_field_1_en: develop a single platform to access and pay for all mobility options!
fields.public_field_3_en: Residents are excited to try the new app and transit operators are hopeful that ridership will increase. Vienna, the capital of Austria, recently released a similar platform for use by its residents. After one year, 21 percent of users reported reducing their car usage. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area could have a similar impact.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other transportation issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: provide free transit to low-income riders!
fields.public_field_3_en: Staff at the local transit agencies are nervous about the strategy’s effect on operations and maintenance costs, but they are excited to serve more riders. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to increase the daily number of transit trips taken by low-income riders by XX percent and reduce the average share of household income spent on transportation by XX percent.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 1 other transportation issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: apply time-of-day tolls on all freeways!
fields.public_field_3_en: Unfortunately, drivers in your city are not happy to be paying more for each trip. They’ve already started donating to your opponent in the next election. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to reduce the average daily vehicle miles travelled per person from XX miles per day to XX miles per day.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other transportation issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: Now that you have gotten some inspiration on pricing and payment policy, it is time to bike over to your next meeting. Unfortunately, you have a flat tire. Luckily, there is a bike shop just down the street. As you are checking out, the bike shop owner starts talking to you about the active transportation section of your transportation plan.
fields.public_field_2_en: I’m listening.

fields.public_field_1_en: Resident 1
fields.public_field_2_en: Did you know that around half of all trips made in our city today are under three miles? That’s a twenty minute ride on a bike or electric scooter. However, biking and walking make up fewer than XX percent of these short trips. What is your transportation plan going to do to encourage more people to leave their cars at home?
fields.public_field_3_en: Go to your transportation plan!

fields.public_field_1_en: Which strategy would you choose to encourage more residents to leave their cars at home for short trips?
fields.public_field_2_en: Make a Decision
Build a complete micromobility network
fields.public_field_3_en: Allocate funding to build a complete network of off-street paths and physically-separated lanes for walking and personal modes of transportation like bicycles and scooters.
fields.public_field_4_en: This strategy would reduce exposure to automobile traffic and make biking and walking safer and more comfortable.
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Strategy 1 pros
fields.public_field_5_en: Building some physically separated lanes would likely require the removal of some on-street parking or travel lanes.
fields.public_field_8_en: Implement Vision Zero speed reduction measures
fields.public_field_9_en: Work with the state government to pass measures reducing the speed limit to 55 miles per hour on all freeways and 25 miles per hour on local streets in communities near public transit or other destinations for cyclists and pedestrians.
fields.public_field_10_en: Reducing automobile speeds could reduce the overall number of collisions and result in fewer fatalities and serious injuries in the event of a collision, while also reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
fields.public_field_11_en: Enforcing speed limit reductions will be difficult, given the large number of roads where new speed limits will be in effect.
fields.public_field_15_en: More than double the size of the existing bike share and scooter share system and make it free to all residents, while providing free shuttle service for those who cannot use these services due to mobility limitations.
fields.public_field_16_en: Electric bikes and scooters can be expensive. This strategy removes the cost barrier to these forms of transportation, allowing more people to use them.
fields.public_field_17_en: This strategy does not directly benefit those who are unwilling to use bike share or scooter share due to the perceived inconvenience or risk.

fields.public_field_1_en: build a complete micromobility network!
fields.public_field_3_en: Residents have already written to planning department staff requesting new paths and improved sidewalks in their neighborhoods. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to increase the share of people that walk or bike to work from XX percent to XX percent by 2050.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 2 other transportation issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: implement Vision Zero speed reduction measures!
fields.public_field_3_en: Residents are likely to find biking, walking, and scootering more enjoyable and more comfortable, increasing the likelihood that they choose to take these modes over driving for short trips. Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to reduce the annual number of traffic deaths from XXX to XXX by 2050. While even one death on our region’s roads is too many, cutting the number of annual traffic deaths in half is a substantial improvement.
fields.public_field_4_en: Now you only have <coins_left> coins to implement strategies related to 1 other transportation issues. Don’t spend too much!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: invest in free short-trip service!
fields.public_field_3_en: Now that the services are free, many residents are trying them out for the first time! Implementing this strategy in the Bay Area is estimated to increase the share of people that walk or bike to work from XX percent to XX percent by 2050. The share of commuters using transit is also estimated to increase by XX percent as more people use bike share or scooter share at the beginning or end of a transit trip.
fields.public_field_4_en: You have <coins_left> coins left. Click here to view your Transportation Plan!
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Remaining budget. <coins_spent> and <coins_left> are available variables

fields.public_field_1_en: Welcome to Bayville
fields.public_field_2_en: Welcome! Bayville is a fictional city in the very real Bay Area. Every day, the city is alive with activity as people travel to work or school, explore the beautiful outdoors, and spend time with family and friends. It’s a great place to live, but like every place, life here does have its challenges.
fields.public_field_2_es: ¡Bienvenido! Bayville es una ciudad ficticia en el verdadero Área de la Bahía. Todos los días, la ciudad está llena de actividad a medida que las personas viajan al trabajo o la escuela, exploran los hermosos espacios al aire libre y pasan tiempo con familiares y amigos. Es un excelente lugar para vivir, pero como todos los lugares, la vida aquí tiene sus desafíos.
fields.public_field_2_cn: 歡迎！ Bayville是一個非常真實的灣區的虛構城市。 每天，當人們前往工作或學校，探索美麗的戶外活動，與家人和朋友共度時光，這座城市充滿活力。 這是一個生活的好地方，但是像每個地方一樣，這裡的生活確實有它的挑戰。
fields.public_field_3_en: Let's start.

fields.public_field_1_en: Bayville has challenges
fields.public_field_2_en: Housing costs are among the highest in the nation. Every morning, commuters sit in traffic or squeeze onto crowded buses and trains. Income inequality is growing year after year. Coastal neighborhoods that flood during big storms today could experience flooding every year if sea levels continue to rise. These problems all exist today and will only get worse with time if we don’t take action.
fields.public_field_2_es: Los costos de vivienda se encuentran entre los más altos de la nación. Todas las mañanas, los viajeros se sientan en el tráfico o se suben a los autobuses y trenes llenos de gente. La desigualdad de ingresos crece año tras año. Los vecindarios costeros que se inundan durante las grandes tormentas de hoy podrían experimentar inundaciones cada año si el nivel del mar continúa aumentando. Todos estos problemas existen hoy y solo empeorarán con el tiempo si no tomamos medidas.
fields.public_field_2_cn: 住房費用是全國最高的。 每天早上，通勤者坐在交通中或擠在擁擠的公共汽車和火車上。 收入不平等逐年增加。 如果海平面繼續上升，今天大風暴期間洪水氾濫的沿海社區每年都會遭遇洪水氾濫。 這些問題今天都存在，如果我們不採取行動，只會隨著時間的推移而變得更糟。
fields.public_field_3_en: That sounds familiar.

fields.public_field_1_en: The future is uncertain
fields.public_field_2_en: Who knows for sure what the future will bring? Will self-driving cars be widely used? Will a major earthquake strike? Will an economic recession occur? These are all questions on the minds of the city’s residents.
fields.public_field_2_es: ¿Quién sabe con seguridad qué traerá el futuro? ¿Se utilizarán ampliamente los autos sin conductor? ¿Se producirá un gran terremoto? ¿Ocurrirá una recesión económica? Todas estas son preguntas en la mente de los residentes de la ciudad.
fields.public_field_2_cn: 誰知道未來會帶來什麼？ 自動駕駛汽車會被廣泛使用嗎？ 會發生大地震嗎？ 經濟衰退會發生嗎？ 這些都是關於城市居民心中的問題。
fields.public_field_3_en: I’m intrigued.

fields.public_field_1_en: Breaking news!
fields.public_field_2_en:
How will your city prepare for the future that lies ahead? That’s up to you! You were just elected mayor. Congratulations!

As mayor, you will create a plan for investments and policies related to transportation, housing, the environment, and the economy for your city through the year 2050. Along the way, you will hear from community members about the challenges affecting their neighborhoods now and in the future. But don’t worry! You will also learn more about potential strategies that you can adopt to help your city and its residents face these challenges head on.
fields.public_field_2_es:
¿Cómo se preparará su ciudad para el futuro que le espera? ¡Eso depende de usted! Acabas de ser elegido alcalde. ¡Felicidades!

Como alcalde, creará un plan de inversiones y políticas relacionadas con el transporte, la vivienda, el medio ambiente y la economía para su ciudad hasta el año 2050. En el camino, escuchará a los miembros de la comunidad sobre los desafíos que afectan a sus vecindarios ahora y en el futuro. Pero no te preocupes! También aprenderá más sobre las posibles estrategias que puede adoptar para ayudar a su ciudad y a sus residentes a enfrentar estos desafíos.
fields.public_field_2_cn:
您的城市將如何為未來的未來做好準備？ 隨你（由你決定！ 你剛剛當選市長。恭喜！

作為市長，您將在2050年之前製定一個與您所在城市的交通，住房，環境和經濟相關的投資和政策計劃。在此過程中，您將聽到社區成員關於現在影響他們社區的挑戰的信息。 在將來。 但別擔心！ 您還將了解更多有關潛在策略的信息，以幫助您的城市及其居民面對這些挑戰。
fields.public_field_3_en: Wow, I’m honored.

fields.public_field_1_en: Game Instructions
fields.public_field_2_en: You will have a budget of 100 coins for each of the four topic areas. You have limited time and financial resources, so you will only be able to choose one strategy to address each challenge.
fields.public_field_2_es: Tendrá un presupuesto de 100 monedas para cada una de las cuatro áreas temáticas. Tiene tiempo y recursos financieros limitados, por lo que solo podrá elegir una estrategia para abordar cada desafío.
fields.public_field_2_cn: 對於四個主題區域，您將擁有100個硬幣的預算。 您的時間和財務資源有限，因此您只能選擇一種策略來應對每項挑戰。
fields.public_field_3_en: Let's start.

fields.public_field_1_en: One more thing before we start...
fields.public_field_1_es: Responda algunas preguntas para que podamos entender mejor quién es nuestro nuevo alcalde.
fields.public_field_1_cn: 請回答幾個問題，以便我們更好地了解我們的新市長是誰。
fields.public_field_2_en: Please answer a few questions so that we can better understand who our new mayor is.
fields.public_field_2_es: Responda algunas preguntas para que podamos entender mejor quién es nuestro nuevo alcalde.
fields.public_field_2_cn: 請回答幾個問題，以便我們更好地了解我們的新市長是誰。
fields.public_field_3_en: What should we call you?
fields.public_field_4_en: Where do you live?
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: Second question

fields.public_field_1_en: Let's Get Started!
fields.public_field_2_en: Choose a topic below to start building a plan.
fields.public_field_2_es: Elija un tema a continuación para comenzar a construir un plan.
fields.public_field_2_cn: 選擇以下主題以開始製定計劃。

fields.public_field_1_en: Welcome to Bayville!
fields.public_field_1_meta_description: Title (NOTE - do not fill in spanish or chinese fields in this step)
fields.public_field_2_en: Chart the course for the future of a fictional Bay Area city by creating plans for transportation, housing, the environment, and the economy. You will have limited time and budget, so choose carefully to ensure your city continues to thrive through the year 2050.
fields.public_field_2_meta_description: Content (NOTE - do not fill in spanish or chinese fields in this step)
fields.public_field_3_en: Select a language to start
fields.public_field_3_meta_description: Content (NOTE - do not fill in spanish or chinese fields in this step)
fields.public_field_4_en: Begin
fields.public_field_4_meta_description: English (NOTE - do not fill in spanish or chinese fields in this step)
fields.public_field_5_meta_description: Spanish (NOTE - do not fill in spanish or chinese fields in this step)
fields.public_field_6_meta_description: English (NOTE - do not fill in spanish or chinese fields in this step)
fields.public_field_7_meta_description: Game description - title (NOTE - do not fill in spanish or chinese fields in this step)
fields.public_field_8_en: This game was created by the Metropolitan Transportation Commission and the Association of Bay Area Governments, two regional planning agencies working together to plan for a better Bay Area.
fields.public_field_8_meta_description: Game description - first half content (NOTE - do not fill in spanish or chinese fields in this step)
fields.public_field_9_en: The purpose of this game is to better understand the strategies San Francisco Bay Area residents might want to see enacted to address the problems projected to affect the region between now and 2050. Feedback collected from this game will inform which strategies are recommended for inclusion in Plan Bay Area 2050, the region’s next-generation blueprint for investments and policy related to transportation, housing, the environment, and the economy over the coming decades.
fields.public_field_9_meta_description: Game description - second half content (NOTE - do not fill in spanish or chinese fields in this step)
